results.title: Punch (Damon Herriman) puppeteer costume
results.credit_line:
Cutting by Justine Coultham

Construction by Stephanie Van Gastel

Shoes made by Brendan Dwyer

Courtesy Vice Media LLC, Blue-Tongue Films and Pariah Productions
results.material_description: new and repurposed materials, cotton, linen, plastic, polyster, suede, rubber
results.brief_description: Judy and Punch scrounge a living doing puppet shows. To help them stand out from the audience, costume designer Edie Kurzer draped Punch (Damon Herriman) in a bold red costume that contrasted spectacularly with the theatre set where the performances were staged.

constellations_primary.name: Judy and Punch and many more
constellations_primary.description: Women have been oppressed by patriarchal conventions and by men under the guise of the supernatural throughout history, but recent moving-image works are reframing these historical persecutions.

results.description:
In Judy & Punch (2019), the titular characters make a living performing puppet shows. To help the performers stand out from the rest of the crowd, costume designer Edie Kurzer draped Judy (Mia Wasikowska) and Punch (Damon Herriman) in bold red costumes. The production team also recognised that the theatre set was going to have a very different feel to the rest of the townâ€™s locations â€“ lots of candlelight and flickering shadows that saturated the scene in yellow light.

Part of Kurzerâ€™s design process is to involve the actors in fashioning their characterâ€™s clothing. Damon Herriman, who plays Punch, said that he wanted to take his jacket off when performing the actual puppeteering, so the shirt beneath was designed to be visually interesting without the jacket.
description_for_label:
In Judy & Punch (2019), the titular characters make a living performing puppet shows. To help the performers stand out from the rest of the crowd, costume designer Edie Kurzer draped Judy (Mia Wasikowska) and Punch (Damon Herriman) in bold red costumes. The production team also recognised that the theatre set was going to have a very different feel to the rest of the townâ€™s locations â€“ lots of candlelight and flickering shadows that saturated the scene in yellow light.

Part of Kurzerâ€™s design process is to involve the actors in fashioning their characterâ€™s clothing. Damon Herriman, who plays Punch, said that he wanted to take his jacket off when performing the actual puppeteering, so the shirt beneath was designed to be visually interesting without the jacket.

Cutting by Justine Coultham

Construction by Stephanie Van Gastel

Courtesy Vice Media LLC, Blue-Tongue Films and Pariah Productions

Construction by Lyn Molloy

results.material_description: new and re-purposed materials, cotton, linen, silk, leather, rubber, metal
results.brief_description: Judyâ€™s everyday outfit is a tapestry of petticoat, skirt, apron, blouse and bodice. This layered approach that costume designer Edie Kurzer took allows different parts of the costume to be added or removed to create different looks, while reflecting the characterâ€™s downtrodden background.

constellations_primary.name: Women, crime and literature
constellations_primary.description: Judy & Punch draws on a classic puppet show that's been reframed by director Mirrah Foulkes as a feminist tale, much like the works that put women at the centre in this Constellation.

results.description: Poverty is rife in the world of Mirrah Foulkesâ€™ Judy & Punch (2019). While Judy and Punch make a living performing marionette shows and have both everyday clothes and puppeteering outfits, most characters in the film, set in the 16th century, can only afford one set of threads. Judyâ€™s everyday outfit is a tapestry of petticoat, skirt, apron, blouse and bodice. This layered approach that costume designer Edie Kurzer took allows different parts of the costume to be added or removed to create different looks, while reflecting the characterâ€™s downtrodden background.
description_for_label: Poverty is rife in the world of Mirrah Foulkesâ€™ Judy & Punch (2019). While Judy and Punch make a living performing marionette shows and have both everyday clothes and puppeteering outfits, most characters in the film, set in the 16th century, can only afford one set of threads. Judyâ€™s everyday outfit is a tapestry of petticoat, skirt, apron, blouse and bodice. This layered approach that costume designer Edie Kurzer took allows different parts of the costume to be added or removed to create different looks, while reflecting the characterâ€™s downtrodden background.

results.brief_description:
Judy’s stunt double’s red puppeteer costume ( Double’s Shirt, Double’s Jacket) from the 2019 film Judy and Punch (Bluetongue Films)

Part of Edie Kurzer (costume designer) proposed ‘Judy and Punch’ donation 2019
results.description: When costume designer Edie Kurzer was crafting the jacket Judy (Mia Wasikowska) wears while performing in puppet shows, she had to create not only something bold that would set the star apart, but also something that would fit the character Polly (Lucy Velik). This meant Kurzer needed to design a piece that would fit two different builds. A double of the jacket with just the sleeves was also made for stand-in puppeteers, who were filmed during close-ups of the charactersâ€™ hands. Having a second costume for stand-ins saves time while shooting so that the main actor doesnâ€™t need to stop working to give a double their costume.
description_for_label: When costume designer Edie Kurzer was crafting the jacket Judy (Mia Wasikowska) wears while performing in puppet shows, she had to create not only something bold that would set the star apart, but also something that would fit the character Polly (Lucy Velik). This meant Kurzer needed to design a piece that would fit two different builds. A double of the jacket with just the sleeves was also made for stand-in puppeteers, who were filmed during close-ups of the charactersâ€™ hands. Having a second costume for stand-ins saves time while shooting so that the main actor doesnâ€™t need to stop working to give a double their costume.
